cleaned_text: with Mortality Seen in Depressed Individuals ](https://www.ucsf.edu/news/2021/04/420226/accelerated-cellular-aging-associated-mortality-seen-depressed-individuals) Cells from individuals with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) were found to have higher than expected rates of methylation at specific sites on their DNA, when compared to cells from healthy individuals without MDD, according to a study by a multidisciplinary team of UCSF, in collaboration with others.
